content: **___** **___** <big><big><big>**for coral and carers**</big></big></big> <big> this pattern is inspired by and dedicated to my paternal grandmother my nana was confined to a wheel chair for many years and i wanted a design with strong bold lines to represent her amazing strength of character </big> <big>the strong bold lines in the central panel also represents the strength of character of all the carers out there this central panel emerges from the toe and heel flap and flows all the way to the cuff creating a lovely sock </big> <big>this is a relatively simple design </big> <big>these socks are worked toe up and feature a wedge toe and heel flap </big> **___** **___** <big>**pattern information**</big> <big>**sizing**</big> adult a-58 sts b-62 sts c-66 sts d-70 sts e-74 sts f-78 sts finished circumference approx 16 17 18 5 19 5 20 5 21 5 cm/6 5 7 7 25 7 75 8 25 8 75 inches <big>**yarn**</big> 100g fingering weight sock yarn solid semi-solid or tonal colourways would work well for this design <big>**gauge**</big> worked in the round and measured after washing and laying flat to dry 36 sts = 10 cm/4 inches over stockinette stitch <big>**needles**</big> for working small circumference in the round 2 25 mm/us1 needles or size required to achieve gauge <big>**pattern formats** </big> the instructions for the construction of the socks are written and the central panel is both charted and written **low vision accessible** a low vision accessible version of this pattern are also available this version include 24 point arial all black text no italics no columns or tables and fully written instructions there are charts included but the charts are not needed to complete the pattern <big>**thank you**</big> thank you to elchkitty rannapiiga1 kohlegrill ninima trii2 tiinaran kirschkern joycoleman and other testers a huge thanks also to yarnymama and yalta for their ongoing valued advice guidance feedback and encouragement
